Title: In the Name of the Father
Notes: A narrative highlighting the importance of never, ever judging a book by its cover.

Title: The Matrix
Notes: Action packed sci-fi thriller that will leave you questioning the validity of your existence and reality.

Title: Inception
Notes: Intense, complex and mind bending sci-fi thrillerthat envelopes the mind with cascading sheets of ponderous realities.

Title: The Shawshank Redemption
Notes: An uplifting satisfying prison drama with sensitive direction and fine performances.

Title: The Big Lebowski
Notes: The movie where every detail matters and doesn't matter at all is as hilarious as ever.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Notes: Beautiful visuals, ambitious story, great characters, lots of heart and is brooding as well.

Title: Avengers: Infinity War
Notes: The culmination of a thrilling, emotionally resonant blockbuster of gargantuan ambitions as the MCU heroes face their gravest threat yet.

Title: Jurassic Park
Notes: A spectacle of special effects and life-like animatronics that evokes sustained awe and sheer terror.

Title: The Departed
Notes: A thoroughly engrossing gangsta drama with gritty authenticity and soupy morality of the law enforcers tasked with taking them down.

Title: Saving Private Ryan
Notes: Harrowing tale of war, brotherhood and sacrifice as a few men risk it all behind enemy lines to save one soldier.

Title: The Godfather
Notes: Greatest mob drama ever told featuring character with great depth and complexity.

Title: The Dark Knight
Notes: Dark, complex and unforgettable thrilling crime saga as Gotham's finest faces off against his greatest foe yet.

Title: 12 Angry Men
Notes: Mechanically written, but within its own middlebrow limitations, it delivers the goods.

Title: Schindler's List
Notes: It's the faces that make Schindler's List a magnificent, harrowing, stomach-wrenching, emotional piece of cinema.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Notes: Pulp Fiction is a moment in the zeitgeist. It is a brash, brattish and unprecedented film that changed everyone who touched it.

Title: Fight Club
Notes: Do not talk about fight club!

Title: Seven Samurai
Notes: Seven Samurai is a spectacle of the human spirit, an interplay of hope and questions about the way of the world, and finally, an epic in which ideas and action converge with a remarkable, vital scope.

Title: The Silence of the Lambs
Notes: An exceptional thriller; a film that puts us in the shoes —and in the eyes— of its protagonist as very few other productions have managed to do.

Title: Interstellar
Notes: It’s a contemplative adventure and an emotional exploration that captivated me from its opening moments.

Title: The Green Mile
Notes: Much of the three-hour movie takes place in the prison, but the resonant characterization, expansive plotting, and judicious use of exterior locations and flashbacks turn the walls into windows.

Title: Parasite
Notes: A tragicomic masterclass that will get under your skin and eat away at your cinematic soul.

Title: Gladiator
Notes: Gladiator benefits from a second half that is, given its focus on Maximus’ vengeance-fueled exploits, virtually overflowing with spellbinding interludes...

Title: American History X
Notes: American History X advocates that "those who ignore history are doomed to repeat it"? It's a powerful social document and should be part of your film watching curriculum.

Title: Whiplash
Notes: It's a thorny, thoughtful movie that asks provocative questions and isn't cocky enough to boast of knowing the answers.

Title: Alien
Notes: It's a story that resonates to this day, in no small part because of the devastatingly human portrayals of each of the Nostromo's crew members.

Title: Aliens
Notes: An extremely ambitious sequel that took a preety sacred first film and built upon it in the most satisfying way. It's a fantastic fantasy movie.

Title: Deadpool
Notes: The merc with a mouth finally lets loose his spiel of insanity.

Title: X-Men
Notes: The struggle for existence as the scion's of evolution's latest project wrestle against a world that fears and despises them.

Title: Oldboy
Notes: A lurid, complex, introspective beast, enacting astonishing cruelty to its protagonaist like a slow-acting poison.

Title: Toy Story
Notes: A pixar classic that still stands as one of the greatest animated movies of all time.

Title: The Boondock Saints
Notes: An enthralling gangsta epic with jolting vigilante justice soaked in juvenile catholc mysticism.

Title: The Departed
Notes: A thoroughly engrossing gangsta drama with gritty authenticity and soupy morality of the law enforcers tasked with taking them down.
